NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a part quoted from a larger written or spoken work 选段，摘录
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I've seen a short excerpt from the film on television.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. an organization that gives out money for certain special purposes 基金会
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The Gulbenkian Foundation gives money to help artists.

NewWords.WordPhrase: become accepted for membership or chosen for office 被接受或录用
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He took the entrance exam but didn't get in.

NewWords.WordPhrase: take from a person or place 带走
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Two chicken curries and rice to take away.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a small piece or bit 小块，少许
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Give the scraps to the dog.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. twist or turn suddenly and forcibly 猛扭，猛拉
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He managed to wrench himself free.
e.g. What brand of soap do you like?

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. on the outside 在外的，外面的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The outer walls of the house were made of brick.
e.g. Opposite the clinic is the administration building.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. make (a special shape) by cutting 雕刻
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The talented artist carved an interesting decoration from a piece of tree root.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vi. wind into a series of circles 盘绕
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The snake coiled round the tree.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. very complicated 复杂的，错综的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He is reading a novel with an intricate plot.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a feeling about sb. or sth. 印象
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. What were your first impressions of London?

NewWords.WordPhrase: advance towards; attack 向…走来；袭击
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She came at me with a rolling-pin.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. say (words) aloud for sb. else to write down 口述而由别人记录
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The French teacher dictates to the class every other week.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. kind, gentle 仁慈的，和蔼的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They are a more benign audience.
e.g. She was taken on as a graduate trainee.

NewWords.WordPhrase: praise in order to recommend, etc. 为（某人）说情，帮（某人）说话
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I hope you get the job. I'll put in a word for you.
